page.title: Nominal Phrases - Agreement
page.introduction: Many languages require agreement between at least some of the modifiers and the head noun. While English only has number agreement, in other languages this agreement may also include animacy, class, or gender.

The grammar rules generated by this starter kit include the constraints for full agreement, but if your language only has partial or no agreement, you simply will not add those features to your lexical items. In that case, the constraints will only apply vacuously. Based on your answers below about the agreement system in your language, you will be instructed to add the appropriate features in the sections that follow.

radioGroup.prompt: Think about the various modifiers that can be included in a nominal phrase. Does your language have any marking on articles, demonstratives, adjectives, etc. to show number agreement with the head noun?
radioGroup.radio: No, there is no agreement, but number marking comes from the number or quantifier
Yes, like English, the various nominal modifiers may/must agree in number with the head noun

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have any additional features which may or must be marked on modifiers so that they agree with the head noun?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, they may/must agree in animacy
